result.execSummary:
The defendant William J Niver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with anyone under 18yrs of age without Court's permission except own biological children - in addition, contact with biological children will also need agent's consent.  Sex offender registry for remainder of life.  May not have contact with Megan and Haley.

10/19/15 - Sentencing Hearing
Cts.1,2, and 4 -Dismissed & read in  kmk
Conditions of Extended Supervision  kmk

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim statement from Jamie N.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 17yrs WSP; initial confinement of 7yrs followed by 10 yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Credit for 180 days.  DNA ordered; notice provided.  Appeal rights.  Sex offender registry for remainder of life.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP
from Jamie N.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to count 3; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed & read-in on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 10/19/15 @ 2pm
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Case is not resolved.  Ludwig hrg held.  JS to remain on for 8/31/15 @ 9am

Court denies the request to fire Atty Henry.  Atty Henry notes the deft would like add'l time to think over the offer.  Court will adjourn the hrg one more time.  FPT set for 8/20/15 @ 1:15pm.
